passage_text: Average Teacher salaries for job postings in Texas are 3% lower than average Teacher salaries for job postings nationwide.

As of 2011, 20 states reported average starting salaries for teachers that were less than $30,000. First-year teachers in Oklahoma, Missouri and Nebraska averaged between $29,000 and $30,000. Mississippi, New Hampshire, South Carolina and Arkansas reported starting salaries of between $28,000 and $29,000.

Texas Art Teacher Salaries. According to the National Education Association, the average starting salary for teachers in Texas (as of the 2012-2013 school year) is $38,091, somewhat higher than the national average of $36,141.

National Pay Scale. According to industry website Teacher Portal, the average starting salary for teachers was $33,950 as of 2011. During the first one to four years, average pay increased to $35,873, while teachers with five to nine years of experience reported annual salaries that averaged $41,391.

Fortunately, Texas pays new teachers well-Texas teacher starting salaries start at $38,091. It obviously depends on the school district-Houston Independent School District (or ISD), Austin ISD, Dallas ISD, El Paso ISD, etc. all range greatly in pay. You'll want to search for those districts separately.

Salary data compiled by the Texas Workforce Commission indicates that the median and average phys ed teacher salary in Texas is $56,764 and $59,845 respectively, which is a difference of only 5%. The average starting wage is $27,890 per year, but the average experience range salary is 36.8% higher at $75,822.

According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, preschool teachers in Texas earned an average of $33,010 per year in 2012. Those in nonmetropolitan areas tended to earn low pay, with a reported average salary of $32,190 in nonmetropolitan southern Texas and $33,740 in nonmetropolitan Gulf Coast Texas.
The average salaries for college professors in Texas range widely by subject area, from a high of $111,930 for health specialties teachers to a low of $56,010 for art and music professors.
Average Teacher salaries for job postings in Houston, TX are 13% higher than average Teacher salaries for job postings nationwide.
